docs.snippet: Without control of his environment, baseball can no longer be a little boys’ game for Jeter. He talked about wanting to start a family, and about his foundation work and publishing venture....
docs.lead_paragraph: Without control of his environment, baseball can no longer be a little boys’ game for Jeter. He talked about wanting to start a family, and about his foundation work and publishing venture.
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Baseball column notes that Derek Jeter's career has been marked by sense of near-absolute control that became compromised after he suffered major ankle injury in 2012; holds that whatever else happens, it is likely that Jeter will manage his exit from the sport with the same self-possession that made him a team hero.

headline.main: Derek Jeter Keeps His Cool, but His Outlook Has Changed
headline.print_headline: Jeter Keeps His Cool, but His Outlook Has Changed

docs.snippet: The Yankees’ captain, addressing last week’s retirement announcement for the first time, showed no emotion as he kept his focus on a final bid for a title....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ captain, addressing last week’s retirement announcement for the first time, showed no emotion as he kept his focus on a final bid for a title.
docs.abstract: Derek Jeter remains cool and composed during news conference to address his retirement announcement, preferring to speak about spring training and coming season than his legacy.

headline.main: Preparing to Retire, Jeter Prefers to Discuss Work
headline.print_headline: A Retiring Star Prefers to Discuss Work
